TopicTitle: how do i add a mod to curse

Articles.Content: how do i add a mod to curse help.

As far as I understand you make an account, upload the mod, then publish the mod.

Never used Curse personally, I prefer Github and/or Dropbox.

Best of luck!

Moving to Kerbal Network, as this is not a question about the game itself.

 

2 hours ago, Jeb-head-mug kerman said:

how do i add a mod to curse help.

 

Is this a mod that you wrote yourself?  Or is it someone else's mod, and you want to put it on Curse?

If it's the latter case:  Please note that all mods have licenses that determine what can and cannot legally be done with them.  Different mods have different licenses; some licenses are very permissive and let you do just about anything, whereas other mods are much more restrictive.

If you're contemplating uploading someone else's mod to Curse:  that may not be allowed by the license.  Please make sure that you never take any actions with any mod that are legally prohibited by that mod's license.

What Snark says. Once you've made a Curse/Curseforge account, it's a pretty simple process to make a project, give it some categories and upload a zip.

Curse is moderated, so your mod won't appear immediately. Once it's been approved, it'll appear.
I am making my own mod but how do i start a new project?
That is a broad question, Jeb-head-mug kerman, but the place to ask would be in the modding subforum.
